definition: to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove

sentences.english: But are you convinced of it?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你對此堅信不移嗎？

sentences.english: Once the breakthrough is still to be committed smiles and life.
sentences.chinese: 一旦突圍仍是矢志不移的笑面人生。

sentences.english: China will unswervingly carry out its independent foreign policy of peace in a comprehensive manner.
sentences.chinese: 中國將堅定不移地綜合執行和平獨立的外交政策。

sentences.english: Fifth, I am unalterably opposed to governmental censorship.
sentences.chinese: 第五，我堅定不移地反對政府檢查制度。

sentences.english: Microsoft, for instance, remains firmly attached to its Windows operating system (see article).
sentences.chinese: 比如微軟就依然堅定不移地死守視窗操作系統。

sentences.english: Our security is assured by our perseverance and by our sure belief in the success of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 對自由的堅信不移和堅忍不拔是我們安全的保證。
他講的是確鑿不移的實情。

sentences.english: Some point is very clear, the Sri Lankan to the buddha's tooth believed that does not move.
sentences.chinese: 有一點很清楚，斯里蘭卡人對佛牙堅信不移。

sentences.english: He confirmed his decree to Jacob, to Israel his eternal covenant.
sentences.chinese: 爲雅各伯立爲不移的規條，向以色列立爲永遠的盟約。

sentences.english: She had a natural courtesy combined with an unshakable conviction.
sentences.chinese: 她既有天生的謙恭有禮的舉止，又有堅定不移的信念。

sentences.english: Nothing in the world is surer than this .
sentences.chinese: 世界上沒有什麼比這更確定不移的了。

sentences.english: The United States is committed to defending religious freedom around the world.” --Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton
sentences.chinese: 美國堅定不移地捍衛世界各地的宗教自由。

sentences.english: I'm extremely annoyed by "must staunchly implement" or something.
sentences.chinese: 我最煩那個“要堅定不移地貫徹”什麼了。

sentences.english: We will pursue an innovation-driven development strategy to create stronger growth drivers.
sentences.chinese: 堅定不移實施創新驅動發展戰略，釋放更強增長動力。

sentences.english: It is steadfastness and courage and hope.
sentences.chinese: 它代表堅定不移，勇氣及希望。

sentences.english: I am willing to total spectrum lasting love song.
sentences.chinese: 我願與你共譜矢志不移的戀歌。

definition: solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to stick to sth without change (idiom); to persevere
to take an oath to do sth/to pledge/to vow
